DataElement.preferredName: First Recurrent Disease Biological Therapy Therapy Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the name of the action or administration of substances which produce a biological reaction in the organism enhancing or restoring the host immune response, modifying the behavior of cancer cells, blocking the pathways of cell neoplastic transformation and tumor ability to metastasize, or facilitating the repairment of cells damaged by aggressive forms of cancer treatment intended to alter the course of a pathologic process of the initial return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: First Recurrent Disease Biological Therapy Therapy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to action or administration of substances which produce a biological reaction in the organism enhancing or restoring the host immune response, modifying the behavior of cancer cells, blocking the pathways of cell neoplastic transformation and tumor ability to metastasize, or facilitating the repairment of cells damaged by aggressive forms of cancer treatment intended to alter the course of a pathologic process of the initial return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.

Property.preferredDefinition: Biological therapy is a form of treatment that implies the administration of substances which produce a biological reaction in the organism enhancing or restoring the host immune response, modifying the behavior of cancer cells, blocking the pathways of cell neoplastic transformation and tumor ability to metastasize, or facilitating the repairment of cells damaged by aggressive forms of cancer treatment.  It includes the use of sera, antitoxins, vaccines, genes, cells, tissues, and organs:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A type of treatment that uses substances derived from or made by living organisms to treat disease; this includes both naturally occurring and synthetic products.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the name of the agent or drug that has been administered to the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI):The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
